intro: Plukenetia lehmanniana, commonly known as the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and yellowish flowers. The tree produces a hard-shelled fruit that contains a single, large edible seed, known as the Brazil nut. It thrives in humid, lowland areas with well-drained soil and requires a warm climate. Due to its economic and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in agroforestry systems.
